description: ok so on 15.01 i submitted a whole revision of the tab where i fixed tempo changes happening a bar too early, fixed vocals being an octave to high, fixed distorted guitar in the verses and fixed some other mistakes like at the beggining of the downpicking riff. and then some very clever person deleted it becase of "troll fix" where it was just a mistake that was in the previous tab and i forgot to fix it. really great work man.
title: Welcome Home (Sanitarium)

description:
Fixed Piano parts
- Guitars -
Revisited the isolated track and decided to put James part the same as kirk's part like the chorus, but played differently since it is very hearable the dissonance at when starting, like the clean part
moved the distorted clean part to the harmony track since it's there in the studio track but it is buried between the main riffage
Added harmonies to second solo
Tried to fix BPM on the last solo, should work somehow but there is absolutely no track that has the BPM change while the solo is playing, so i force bpm changed it with 32 notes on kirk's harm guitar, should not be that noticeable
now tab should be good, if anyone wants the stems I can upload them, just leave a note on Bar 1 of the piano so when i check the tab I upload it
title: Welcome Home (Sanitarium)

description: FIXED TEMPO ERROR SAME AS LAST TAB
title: Welcome Home (Sanitarium)

description:
Added slides to the chorus finally and added the tail of the chorus riff for the little dissonant harmony in bar 57 (You can clearly hear this in isolated tracks)
Also fixed the other chorus tail for all its repetitions.
Fixed the slides on the solo ending lick and also fixed note ties in solo 1 and 2 for correct bend vibratos and durations. Also fixed a wrong note in bar 32 which was one string too high. All that is left is the harmony/2nd guitar that is clearly heard in parts of the second solo but I don't feel like doing it Clay have fun with that.
title: Welcome Home (Sanitarium)

description:
FIXED A LOT (Thank me later) 
TEMPO:
1. Increased from 98 to 109 in some of the later riffs
2. Ending declines speed better and has a 2/4 bar to smoothen the transition as well.
3. The song shouldn't speed up at the wrong times to early anymore

NEW MEASURE: added another measure of buildup before the third solo which has the correct eighth notes instead of the 1 measure 16th notes.

REVERTS:
reverted some bits of the solo to the old tab because even though some were the same exact notes the placements were better in the original version

SOLOS:
1. 1st solo intro reverted and proper ghost note added.
2. power-chords brought back and added the correct notes for the first time in bar 24
3. some slide edits too
4. 2nd solo bar 65 reverted because it was better for playing otherwise mostly untouched
5. third solo added some harmonics to bars 140 something they are probably not accurate but it's better than nothing.
6. 4th solo added palm mutes to a bluesy lick and increased the tempo.
title: Welcome Home (Sanitarium)
